caption: Talk show host Oprah Winfrey is pregnant with her first child at 61.

result.explanation: The image shows Oprah Winfrey, but she is not pregnant. The caption is factually incorrect.

candidates.title: FALSE: Oprah Winfrey Pregnant with First Child at 61
candidates.content:
Claim:
Talk show host Oprah Winfrey is pregnant with her first child at 61.
In early December 2015, the web site CelebTriCity published an article reporting that talk show host Oprah Winfrey was pregnant with her first child at the age of 61:
AFTER SEEING MARK ZUCKERBEG AND HIS WIFE GO THROUGH THERE PREGNANCY IT JUST INSPIRED ME TO HAVE MY OWN BABY"  OPRAH
Oprah Winfrey has more money ($3 Billion) than she will ever be able to spend in her lifetime, so choosing to have this child means her baby will be born a billionaire. She reportedly can't stop crying tears of joy as this is the one thing she has always wanted since she lost her baby at 14.
There is no truth to the above-quoted story. CelebTriCity is one of many fake news web sites currently operating on the Internet, and their disclaimer notes that CelebTriCity is "the most notorious entertainment website in the world" which publishes "shocking headlines" and a combination of "real & satire news" in order to keep its "visitors in a state of disbelief."
In addition to the site's disclaimer, readers could have determined that the above-quoted article was fake by checking it against other sources. Oprah has not made any pregnancy announcement on her social media accounts, nor has this rumor been covered by any major news publication.
[article-meta]
candidates.description: Talk show host Oprah Winfrey did not announce that she was pregnant with her first child at age 61.

result.explanation: The provided evidence directly contradicts the news caption. Snopes.com explicitly debunks the claim that Oprah Winfrey is pregnant with her first child at 61, citing the claim's origin from a fake news website and the lack of corroboration from reliable sources.
result.supporting_points: Source 1: Snopes.com article directly refutes the claim, stating it originated from a fake news website and lacks evidence from reliable sources.

final_result.explanation: The claim that Oprah Winfrey is pregnant is factually incorrect. Both internal and external validation methods strongly indicate that the caption is out of context. The internal check analyzes the image itself, which clearly shows Oprah Winfrey, but there is no visual evidence suggesting pregnancy. The internal check provides a confidence score of 10 and a verdict of False, concluding that the caption is factually incorrect. The external check further reinforces this conclusion by referencing a Snopes.com article that debunks the pregnancy claim. This article provides evidence that the claim originated from a fake news website and lacks support from reliable sources. The external check also gives a confidence score of 10 and a verdict of False, supporting the internal assessment.  There is no discrepancy between the internal and external checks; both methods consistently confirm that the caption is false and out of context.  The visual evidence of the image directly contradicts the news caption.  There is no evidence of image manipulation or miscontextualization. The image simply shows Oprah Winfrey with two dogs, and there is no visual indication that she is pregnant.  In summary, based on the combined confidence scores of 10 from both the internal and external checks and the consistent findings of both methods, there is strong evidence to confidently conclude that the news caption is factually incorrect and completely out of context with the provided image. The absence of any pregnancy-related visual cues in the image and the explicit debunking by a reliable source like Snopes.com eliminate any ambiguity or uncertainty in the assessment. Therefore, the final verdict is decisively that the caption is out of context.
final_result.validation_summary: Both internal and external validation methods confirm that the caption is out of context. The image shows Oprah Winfrey with dogs, but there's no visual evidence of pregnancy, and the claim is debunked by Snopes.com.
